channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At U.N. Climate Summit, U.S. Stands Alone
item.description: On Wednesday in New York, countries lined up to say they would accelerate their efforts to cut greenhouse-gas emissions. In staying away, the U.S. was...

item.title: World leaders at UN shocked by ‘macabre response’ on social media to Charlie Kirk’s death
item.description: Serbian President Alexsandar Vucic decried the “sick expression of joy for the crime committed against an innocent person."

item.title: UN traffic in New York is so bad that Emmanuel Macron couldn’t even cross the street while talking to Donald Trump on the phone
item.description: "Guess what? I’m waiting in the street because everything is frozen for you!”

item.title: This Conquistador Changed History. Neglect Haunts His Tomb in Mexico
item.description: Hernán Cortés toppled the Aztecs, winning Mexico for Spain. His trash-strewn resting place reflects how the conquest is still fueling quarrels and tes...

item.title: U.S. new-home sales unexpectedly jump over 20% in broad advance

item.title: Gen Z revolutionaries worldwide have a common emblem: A pirate flag from ‘One Piece,’ the best-selling manga in history

item.title: Gen Z’s hiring nightmare is really about discrimination. ‘Youngism’ is worse than AI when it comes to eating entry-level jobs
item.description: In the U.S., federal age-bias protections under the Age Discrimination in Employment Act begin at 40, which leaves Gen Z in a legal blind spot.
